About Me

Hi, my name is Suzanne, and I'm a student at Carnegie Mellon University majoring in Statistics and Machine Learning. In relevant prior and current coursework, I have studied methods for statistics and data science, imperative computation, physical computing, functional programming, probability theory, interaction design, and computer systems. I'm eager to work outside my knowledge set and develop my expertise. Currently seeking Fall 2020 and Summer 2021 opportunities!

Experience

Orbex Labs

Computer Science Intern - May 2020 - August 2020

Developed Project Echo, a platform at the intersection of telephony, messaging, and CRM to facilitate customer calls and information, transcribe meetings and filter details, and allow clients to access results of completed meetings

  • APIs used: socket.io, WebRTC, Google Cloud Platform (Storage, Speech-to-Text, Logging)
  • Domain run using Google Compute Engine
  • Planned daily SCRUM and software sprints
  • Held weekly presentations on project progress

Automated Soundboard

Check out the github page and the demo video.
Users can input .wav files into a chosen sized soundboard, play them with their keyboard, add certain effects to their sounds, record what they play, and create automated default beats or new ones, selected based on frequency.

python numpy pyaudio threading

Project title

Check out the Project Documentation Final Documentation on Course Site For this physical computing project, we collaborated with Osher students to implement a useful device for their daily lives. My group, my group, Estevan, Meijie, and myself, worked with Beth; our device is designed to help her clean-up and beautify her vast yard. Our moss-spreading device is a remote-controlled car with a blender on the top, a tank to hold moss, and a funnel to dispense the mixture at the bottom. The purpose of the car is to cover land with a beautiful, even layer of moss with minimal effort.

C Arduino Arduino IDE Tinkercad
